title: James Griffett, tenor who co-founded the early-music vocal ensemble Pro Cantione Antiqua – obituary
text:
James Griffett, the tenor, who has died aged 80, was a relative latecomer to the professional music scene but emerged to become one of the leading singers of his generation.

A performer of wide sympathies, highly adept at operating on all sides of the cultural divide, he as a founding member of the vocal ensemble, Pro Cantione Antiqua; his pioneering approach undoubtedly helped lay the solid foundations of performance practice that we now accept as commonplace. Likewise, his expertise as a teacher helped to mould the creative personalities of many of this country’s leading practitioners.

He was born James Kenneth George Parsons in Stevenage on April 30 1939; his father, James Parsons, was a maths...
description: James Griffett, the tenor, who has died aged 80, was a relative latecomer to the professional music scene but emerged to become one of the leading singers of his generation.
